result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shana R. Rivera

defendant.name: Rivera, Shana R.
defendant.address: 2743 W. Highland Blvd Apt 107, Milwaukee, WI 53208

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Case Called: 1:49 p.m.
Clerk: Nicole.

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears via Zoom video with Atty Adam Fontana for Atty Peter Vu.

Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea: NOT GUILTY.

Dates set:
CC: 11/9/22 @ 1:00 p.m.
Bond:  Continued


Adj: 1:52 p.m.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: State appears by ADA Kerri Puig. Deft appears in person with Atty Peter Vu. Offered provided.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Deft's notice of PTC on 9/28/2022 and Prelim on 10/26/2022 - 'return to sender; attempted - not known; unable to forward'

Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2022 at 08:50 am.
Preliminary Hearing on October 26, 2022 at 01:50 pm.

No contact with victim(s): R.T. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing
